intro: Seseli lehmannianum, commonly known as Lehmann's seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound umbels of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Seseli lehmannianum is native to Central Asia and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
